document.docAuthor: Barahona-Segovia, Rodrigo M., Riera, Pamela, Pañinao-Monsálvez, Laura, Guzmán, Vicente Valdés & Henríquez-Piskulich, Patricia
document.masterDocTitle: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Updating the knowledge of the flower flies (Diptera: Syrphidae) from Chile: Illustrated catalog, extinction risk and biological notes

bibRefCitation.author: Philippi, P. I.
bibRefCitation.refString: Philippi, P. I. (1865) Aufzahlung der chilenischen Dipteren. Verhandlunger der Zoologisch- Botanischen Gesellschaft in Wien, 15, 595 - 782. https: // doi. org / 10.5962 / bhl. title. 9295

figureCitation.captionText: FIGURES 80–86. Stilbosoma cyanea Philippi, 1865: (80) lateral view, resting in leaves, Reserva Nacional Coyhaique (photo by Patricia Medina) and (81) visiting Myrceugenia planipes (Hook. & Arn.) O. Berg, Estación Biológica Senda Darwin (photo by Rodrigo Barahona-Segovia). Stilbosoma rubiceps Philippi, 1865: (82) visiting Eryngium paniculatum Cav & Dombey ex. F. Delaroche, Península de Hualpén (Photo by Josefina Arce); (83) visiting Helianthus annuus L., Arauco (photo by Nicolas Riffo); (84) resting in a tree, Cerro Caracol, Concepción (photo by Francisco Andana). Aneriophora aureorufa Philippi, 1865: (85) visiting flowers of M. planipes, Estación Biológica Senda Darwin (photo by Rodrigo Barahona-Segovia); (86) dorsal view (photo by Matías Barceló). Scale bar = 1 mm.

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type locality and data.
“ Santiago , Chile ” (T, A, MNHNCL )
.

.
Chilean distribution. From Valparaíso to Los Lagos región ( Fig. 87 ).
Altitudinal range. From coastal to highland ecosystems (14– 2,000 m .a.s.l.).

Biology and notes.
Stilbosoma rubiceps
is associated with native forests and its plant species such as
M. exsucca
(J.H., A.W. and A.M. Skevington pers. comm. from CNC). Nonetheless, organic crops such as
Persea americana Mill.
or
Helianthus annus
L. are also visited by this fly (Fabián Soto and Nicolas Riffo, CSP records respectively; see Fig. 83 ). Also, this fly visit flowers of the native
E. paniculata
(Josefina Arce, CSP record; Fig. 82 ).
Conservation status. LC; EOO = 219,379 km 2 , AOO = 92 km 2 , 21 subpopulations and 22 localities.
